Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gadget_Goddess
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mozart Amsterdam is on the Prinsengracht canal and within walking distance to most areas in Amsterdam: 1. Good location 2. Good service 3. Awfully-small rooms the size of cupboards 4. Awful WIFI service which is programmed to auto cut-off after one hour use. If WIFI is important either do not book here OR walk to the Apple Store in Leidseplein about 3 minutes away and use their WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Ok basic hotel, did the job!!”
Reviews.Author: alison2603
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as it said it was in good location. We had a canal view room on the first floor room 102. You open the door and it hits the wardrobe, the room had 3 single bads in it, 2 pushed together. The room was pretty cold and i had to use the extra beds duvet. Breakfast wasnt great, there was cereal with a very sweet milk and there was one type of cheese, salami and ham and fruit salad which i would say was out of a tin. the breakfast area was just in the foyer of the hotel which i found strange. the hotel was a couple of minutes walk from a tram stop which was great and just around the corner from one of amsterdams main streets for entertainment. for the 255 euro for 3 nights, we got what we paid for a basic hotel in a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Mark O
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because of it's excellent location. Located on the Prinsengracht right next to the Leidseplein means that all of Amsterdam's main attractions and hot spots are easily reached. The rooms are rather small and basic and not the cleanest and although canal views may be available my view was of another guests room, not ideal. Didn't bother with breakfast on either day as it didn't look up to much. I would advise people to look elsewhere as places of a better standard are available for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful but pay for a canal view.”
Reviews.Author: ianwall
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and means you're within walking distance to all attractions. I was lucky enough to stay in a "canal view" room, while the rest of my group was in a standard room. My room was clean, quiet and with full sized windows bright and airy. By contrast, the standard rooms were either internal or had limited daylight (basement / lightwell etc). These weren't so good and a big step down from the canal view room. Overall though, things were adequate for our parties needs, especially as al rooms can be split as a double or a twin. If you're staying here and it's not a lot more, I'd always opt for the canal view room.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth it...”
Reviews.Author: Kuz432 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel easily using the 1, 2 or 5 tram in under 10 mins from the station, and the hotel is literally half a minute walk from the stop. However, the room STANK...the drains in the bathroom smelled of mould and needed a good scrub down. The 'flatscreen tv' they advertise was a let down too, as my mobile has a bigger screen. The view was of the back of the lift shaft. On the plus side the bed was really comfy and, as I said before, the hotel is close to the tram stop. Not really worth the 85 euros i don't think..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bladeonholiday Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice location on the Princengacht canal, quiet area but close to Leidesplein, Rembrandplein and the museum quarter, easy to get to from the station on tram 1, 2 or 5 then 2 min walk, lots of nice bars and restaurants nearby 15 minute walk to Dam square and red light district. Rooms are small but clean, we had a free upgrade to Canal view on the front of the hotel, so very good value for money. Don't bother with the breakfast, the breakfast room is dingy and there are plenty of places nearby where you can get a nice breakfast for about the same price. Will definitely use the Mozart again. Also this hotel has a lift which is unusual in Amsterdam hotels apparently, so would suit people with mobility problems

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, locaton & standard of cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: rach w
Reviews.Content: we were worried after reading reviews, we booked a canal view double room and specified through booking.com that we wanted a double as opposed to a twin, which we got. the room was a good size for what we wanted, double bed, small wardbrobe, small desk n chair. the bathroom was really clean and well presented. it had a tv, however we didnt use it. breakfast was pants but there was stuff there, good nescafe coffee machine with any drink, which is all i have anyway, my boyfriend had cereal and fresh milk and a fresh banana for afters, there were fresh breads, eggs, (and a microwave under the side) butters, jams, hams, cheeses and fruit salad (tin stuff)....so a good selection in all fairness im just picky at breakfast so coffee was perfect for me, i would recommend them getting a toaster. Yes you do eat it in the lobby, but its not as bad as some have described, its set back a bit. staff were friendly enough, gave us some directions and let us check in early. overall good value for money for the room and location...and good......excellent coffees at breakfast which we were paying 2.50 for in cafes and coffeeshops....so for me it was 10 euros for us both in the morning plus the orange juice we were saving on. location is fantastic! Would definately stay again in the same room.

Reviews.Title: “You got what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: TrippersAust
Reviews.Content: The stay here was fine. The rooms tiny, but you are in Amsterdam and space is precious. The lift was small and would only fit our son and only one of us, so the other used the stairs. Reception were friendly. Breakfast was basic and very average, but it was edible. Location was fantastic. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal and surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: PaddyirishmanCork
Reviews.Content: Given some previous reviews was worried but room was great value for â‚¬70, 402 overlooking canal, spacious, clean and comfortable, location is ideal. Have often paid more for lesser quality. Only caveat is that when we were checking out another patron was at reception conplaining about the size of their room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , value for money”
Reviews.Author: scabailey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mozart for 1 night on a recent football trip 6 of us in 2 triple rooms worked out at Â£25 per person. Hotel was clean and rooms comfortable , good location and worth the money if your looking for resanoble priced hotel with good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1Chancer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel overnight 16th April,situated over looking one of the canals this hotel is in an ideal place,just a few hundred yards from the tram stop,line2/5 and 10 mins from Amsterdam central station.Very quick and easy booking in by very pleasant lady,room was basic,two single beds and a quite spacious ensuite bathroom for the size of the room.Beds were comfy and room clean which is all you can ask for,ideal for the short stay i was on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kevandkath
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at The Mozart and it was just what we wanted.Eating out,bars,transport etc are only a short walk around the corner.We didnt expect anything to fancy for the price but the Hotel was clean and the staff were pleasant and helpfull.The Mozart is in the Ideal spot to explore Amsterdam, we would use the Mozart again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay J
Reviews.Content: Like others my wife and I were a little wary after reading the reviews and even considers canceling our reservations. We are very glad we didn't. The rooms are small as customary in Europe but comfortable. The breakfast is also European but was more then adequate. We also found the staff friendly and accommodating. This is a great place for location as well. Very close to the museum district, the Ann Frank House, numerous stores and cafes, and the tram. If you knew an inexpensive hotel that is close to the sites this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient location”
Reviews.Author: chicaism
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Mozart hotel with my boy friend in January. I chose the accommodation because of the location and low rate. I was going to museums and wanted to be close to nice restaurant and cafe area so that we don't have to take tram to go home after dinner. I don't spend time in room while traveling in new city anyway. This was right place. 5 minutes walk from tram #1,2,and 5 Prinsen street stop, and 10 minutes to the the 3 major museums. Restaurants were plenty in 5 minutes walking distance like Italian, Dutch, Argentinian, Japanese, Indonesian, cafe and bars. Room we stayed was quiet, small and dark. Just enough to sleep. It would be much better if you get a room on street side with big windows, but I think I would not have got it because I booked the cheapest double/twin room with the lowest price online. Fresh towels everyday, bed was not too old, warm central heating. Just enough to sleep. We did not have breakfast at the hotel because there were nice coffee shops like starbucks, local bakeries had lovely pastries and sandwich and pubs at Leodseplein open early to big English style breakfast or pancakes. But their breakfast looked just fine. People at the reception were nice, helpful if you have questions about sightseeing. So all and all, everything was just enough for the price I paid and I got what I looked for. Recommend to budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Do not listen to bad reviews, there is nothing wrong with is hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jrawley
Reviews.Content: We were a little bit wary on staying at this hotel due to the reviews, but once we arrived and checked in there was nothing to worry about! The staff are really friendly and couldnt help you more. Ok the rooms are on the small side but that doesnt compare to how amazing Amsterdam is. The hotel is situated right round the corner from all the bars and restaurants but still within walking distance from all the attractions. There are regular trams throughout the day that take you all over the city, but we decided to walk the whole 5 days. We had such an amazing time that We would deffinately recommend this hotel as afterall its just somewhere to rest your legs after a long day of sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lexa85
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel shame about the view. Went to Amsterdam for Christmas weekend away. The staff where very nice and polite. The room was just what we needed. Very nice clean bathroom. Sadly the room only had a small window that faced onto someone else's room so we had to keep the curtains closed. There is free wifi on each floor and the breakfast was ok. Reasonably priced for what it offers and would recommend to anyone on a budget. We didn't need anything more than bed, TV, en-suite bathroom and breakfast so we where very happy with the hotel. There is a lift as well so no dragging luggage upstairs. Front doors all 24 hours with security staff too. Hotel is completely no smoking (of any kind) which was a nice change for Amsterdam cheaper hotels. Defiantly a better place for a more refined traveler still on a small budget. Excellent location within walking distance for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jonahict
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here I was worried about what I had booked myself into. it is easy to get to this hotel. Tram number 1, 2 or 5 from centraal station and a 2 minute walk to hotel. After checking in to the hotel we went to our room the rooms are small so I thought i was going to be in for a horrid time, that was the only thing I found wrong with this hotel and that didnt bother me once I knew it was the size it is. The staff were excellent, I had trouble sending my email to the hotel to print my boarding pass and the manager (I think he was the manager) let me use his own personal computer to get the details to print. I had a few questions at various points over my stay and every member of staff helped me. I think other reviewers are not used to the way the Dutch are and sometimes they come across abrubt but that is just the way they are. I would recommend this Hotel as the area it is in is easy travelling to all parts of the city and staff helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing...tiny dark rooms and horrid breakfast room.”
Reviews.Author: karunavira
Reviews.Content: I did not check the reviews and just booked this hotel with Co-op travel...i guess i trusted their reputation more than i should have. The tiny room had a metre square window opening onto a narrow smelly and dark well. So absolutely no day light and no room to walk around the two narrow beds pushed together. The breakfast room was just a wide corridor off the reception with plastic tables and chairs and a noisy TV on the wall...and with all sorts of clutter and laundry bags around it. My wife and i are used to European hostels and are not that fussy buit this was so bad we had to just leave and take our chances to find another hotel...and lose our money for the booking. At least hostels can have an ok atmosphere but this had nothing to recomend it except its location in the city...but, there are ,much better places in simialr locations so i suggest yop look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: EsenCo
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great, 3 minutes walking distance to leidseplein square and near the canal. The staff were friendly and helpfull. The room was quite small but you can manage yourself. They did cleaning everyday and changing the towels. The major problem was the elevator. It was broken all the time and everytime we want to use it, we waited a lot. But the location vs. the price it was absolutely worthed!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel comfortable”
Reviews.Author: denisepep
Reviews.Content: Toilet hadn't been flushed. Staff weren't friendly. Room was tiny and the hotel was noisy. Bed was not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cheap”
Reviews.Author: kjetilho
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location close to Leidseplein and the tram line, but no noise is to be heard from the outside. My room (003) was a bit cramped, but the twin bed was big and soft, the bathroom had a tub, and everything was very clean. The TV screen was quite small, but the selection of channels was good. They had even fitted a small table/shelf with power conveniently nearby for using your laptop. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: cyclotimia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel without reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and regretted it. Agreeing with the all statements said above - central location (which is the only good point), very mediocre breakfast lacking hot meals, noisy ambience, strange smell in the room due to not enough ventilation, - also: 1) This hotel marked as a non-smoking one, but we could regularly smell marijuana in the lobby. How come? 2) The bathroom really lacks places to put our things. No towel hook, not even a flush toilet cover (which would be very handy to put clothes on it while showering!). Plus, the shower unit glass door is leaking, therefore the floor is always wet after showering. 3) The window in our room was unable to open. It had some ventilation feature, we kept it open all the time but it wasn't enough and the air was all the time very still. 4) Really, REALLY too few electrical sockets to plug in bed lighting and laptop and charge the camera in the same time. I'm definitely not coming back and wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking”
Reviews.Author: Laurenmb
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night for a two day side trip to Amsterdam while visiting Belgium. We loved Amsterdam. We hated this hotel. Location was decent, but not so convenient to make it worth it. Too far from many attractions. Also our room smelled very strange... like a strong bathroom odor. All night long we heard loud noises through the walls, sounding like moving furniture. I sent my husband to talk to the front desk - they stated that the noise was coming from the next building and nothing could be done. I decided not to go to the lobby for breakfast.. i thought this was a weird set-up anyway. My husband did have some breakfast, and said it was nothing special... We booked here last minute, and even when dealing with the front desk on the phone, i felt that i would have been better to spend more time looking for another hotel. Dont bother.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ara4celi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in Mozart hotel.got a small room in basement,with a bad smell.The room is small and unequipped.The lobby in hotel is functioning as a breakfast room and a luggage room.The breakfast ist poor.The only good thing I can say it's a location-it's really central.I would never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there”
Reviews.Author: SoriNat
Reviews.Content: My husband had to stay at this hotel last week for 3 nights. It was very hard to find a hotel at this time in Amsterdam as there was this huge TV event in Amsterdam and all the city was full. So he was pleased to find this hotel. Despite an enormous price he had to pay he was excited about it as it is located well. But location was the only good thing...He felt desperate in this hotel - the room was tiny (when you open the door, it touches the bed, the window was impossible to open as it clashed with the neigbouring open window), if you wanted a tea, you had to get it from the machine that took coins only and they never had coins at the reception... And the walls were so thin that he could hear his neighbour snore in the other room and could not sleep all night. Do not go there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An average hostel”
Reviews.Author: karlos86
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking bought us to the Mozart Hotel Amsterdam. Later in our holiday in Paris I read the all the terrible reviews, borderline furious at the money I paid, I even went to the extent of finding some alternatives if it was that bad. Was a long train journey to Amsterdam, not a great start. When we arrived there was a man complaining that he booked a double bed and it was just two single beds pushed together (which is true). But I have to say that our experience was not as bad as some of the reviews, but that doesn't mean that there not true! Our first room on the top floor was very small and extremely warm, which I had read in other reviews. But it was clean enough. So after asking we got moved to the third floor, slightly bigger room, window with sun etc. Reminded me of some private rooms in average hostels you see. Deffinatly NOT hotel standard!!! Staff were friendly enough, didn't have an issue. Was pre-warned about the breakfast and was totally the right choice, theres so many great cafe's nearby for breakfast...so go there!! The scariest thought, is you get a room in the 500's which do not be fooled is not on the 5th floor...its in the basement...IN THE BASEMENT!!! I can't imagine what its like in there. Surely it would be illegal to leave cattle in such conditions. The hotel is in a FANTASTIC location, baffles me why the standard is so low...you could really make something special here!!! Someone buy this hotel, rebrand and start again!! Cumon owners, surely you read the bad reviews?

Reviews.Title: “Bloody awful, disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: rachrach777
Reviews.Content: The room was so small ,so insisted on another room ,wasn't much better ,curtains were ripped and filfy ,staff were miserable and very unhelpful .breakfast was a waist of time and was like eating in a waiting room .dont go here its a big let down :-(

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - but still one of worst hotels stayed in for a long time”
Reviews.Author: UKMatt32
Reviews.Content: Ok so the hotel is located conveniently and close to some nice restaurants and nightlife. The rooms are not big enough to swing a cat in and are dated... One of my towels was dirty and the window had a crack in it which meant I could not open it. Not great with no AC and a hot hotel room. The hotel receptionists were all helpful. Breakfast is a little limited and very strange that you eat in the lobby of the hotel This hotel seems to have missed an "s" from its should be a hostel... Please don't stay here.....

Reviews.Title: “Fair but could improve”
Reviews.Author: ianandjoan
Reviews.Content: Helpful reception staff. Continental breakfast very adequate. Wireless WiFi worked when it wanted to even with three wireless addresses. Best to connect in lobby then keep it linked in even if you have to go up in the veeeery slooow lift to the 4th floor. The room was reasonably clean with comfortable beds. The main problem which MUST be addressed is the heat in the upper room(s?) we had 404 (and this has been commented on in other previous posts elsewhere) The ambient outside temperature was never more than 20C. It must be horrendous if higher in the summer months. The existence of a small fan which shows the management are aware, does not improve matters much and an open window helps little too because most rooms open up into a central well which also enables you to hear other guests conversations!!!. It would be a relatively simple task to install air-con at the top floor. The power supply was somewhat 'Heath Robinson' insofar as there was insufficient outlets for the requirements, the solution being a multi plug extension cable hung on the wall outlet to plug in the TV, fan, wall light power supply and any other device. Not a good idea for fire prevention and safety!! This would not be allowed in any UK hotel room. Internal noise was excessive from adjoining rooms due to insufficient wall insulation competed with the disturbance received from the above noise (opposing open windows) Handy location though. Hardly value for money however because of the downsides. Could do better. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Most of the reviews are over the top... I found this hotel done the job for a long weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: shanahan_18
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the weekend before valentines day 2011 with my boyfriend, I arrived Friday morning and returned Sunday night. I had read all the awful reviews before going (including that terrifying one about being worse than a hostel in Bangkok) so i was very worried before arriving as i have also traveled and stay in many hostels in Thailand and Bangkok haha! I found the room very small but clean the bathroom looked brand new and was very clean!!The room was just what we needed really for a cheap get away, we never spent much time in the room as we were out exploring the city there is so much to see and do you don't want to be wasting your time in a hotel room anyway! The location couldn't have been more perfect it was set 2 minutes off the main road and a 2 minute walk away from the tram line that can take you any where! There are loads of restaurants, fast food, smoking cafes, bars, night clubs, shops, clothes shops H&M was a 5 minute walk from are hotel perfect for anyone wanting to shop! If you are looking for a cheap get away don't let the other reviews put you off the hotel isn't a 5 star hotel and the rooms are very small but no were near as bad as some people have made out! Also i found the staff at the desk very helpful they gave us discount vouchers when we went to Anna Franks house and free map! Things you must try Anna Franks house, Van Gogh museum, zoo, canal cruse, Irish bars food in the square so tasty!!! The tram will take you to all of these places just ask tram driver!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: touifi
Reviews.Content: Having checked the website of the hotel which seemed quite decent and based on its excellent location and the seemingly good price of the accommodation, I decided to stay overnight to Mozart Hotel in the context of a business trip a week ago... It has been the WORST HOTEL I've ever stayed. The room was too small, on the basement, dark and dirty. I even found blood stains on a towel and hairs on the bed linen. The lobby was quite pathetic and thank God I didn't pay 8euros extra in order to have breakfast there. I actually pity the poor tourists that were having breakfast on that lobby the next morning... There was a free wifi connection, but heyyy... didn't work on the basement!!! What a surprise! I really believe any good reviews belong to the hotel's staff. To conclude... AVOID THIS HOTEL! DO NOT GO THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unfortunately very unhelpful staff .”
Reviews.Author: cherryames1949
Reviews.Content: Only needed to stay one night before boarding a riverboat. The location couldn't have been better. The room was clean but it was also small, dreary and hot. The staff was preoccupied and not very helpful. For one night it was okay BUT I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there...”
Reviews.Author: queenofhearts12350
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mozart hotel for 2 nights in January 2011. We arrived later on in the evening, and upon arrival, the man on reception was more interested in playing on his computer than checking us in. He was so unhelpful. After telling us to "wait 5 minutes" for him to finish with his computer, he checked us in, and told us our room number. The breakfast area is within the reception area, and we could already see the juices etc. out from the previous day ready for the next morning! Needless to say, we cannot comment on the breakfast as we did not give that a try. We asked him to point out on a map the location of the hotel to help us get our bearings, the receptionist did not know the location, and only when I told him "I think we are around this area" he drew a huge circle on the map and told us we were somewhere within this area. We went into our room and struggled to open the door, because the gas heater that was being used previously in there was blocking the door as the heating was not working. The shower was still dirty from previous occupants. We had holes in our towels. We must have been next to a smoking area, as our non-smoking room was really smelling of smoke. We knew we were booking something basic, and that we got. We have stayed in many European cities and this was the worst hotel we have seen. The standards to us did not seem 3* as we were told the hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Way better than some of the reviews make it out to be!!”
Reviews.Author: maryd88
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute in a bit of a rush...without reading any of the reviews! After reading a few I was really worried that we'd be stuck staying somewhere horrible, but when we got there I realised that a lot of the reviews of the place had been unnecessarily harsh. We paid â‚¬210 for a triple room for 3 nights, which I think was extremely good value. Our room was spotlessly clean and definitely not as small as some people make them out to be. It had two twin beds joined together and another single bed just inside the door, and my two friends and I still had plenty of room to move around when we were getting ready. The beds were on the small side, but were very comfortable and clean. The only negative was that the walls were quite thin and you could hear a lot of noise in the corridors of people returning to their rooms. The location is brilliant; just around the corner from the Leidseplein, one of the main going out areas with bars, restaurants and clubs. It is about a 15 minute walk from the city centre and there is also a tram stop a minutes walk away. I also found the staff to be quite friendly and helpful if I had any problems or questions. This hotel is by no means luxurious but it is perfectly fine if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep that is in a good spot in the city. Do not be put off by reviews saying it's disgusting, grubby, etc. It is just a basic hotel with no frills and is great for somewhere to throw down your bags and head off to explore Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: tecnoian
Reviews.Content: hi everyone is saying in their reviews that the hotel is clean and tidy,well im sorry did you look at the curtains they are all black on the bottom and they are supposed to be white..... the pillows had no cases on them and the pillow was all yellow with stains,we asked to see different rooms as our one was nothing like the ones in the pictures that are on the hotel website when we checked the other rooms they where even smaller than ours. and then the smell of someone smoking now im a smoker but i dont do it in my bedroom so why stay in a hotel room that stinks of smoke. we booked in for 4 days to this hotel and didn't even stay there one night,and when getting our money back from the hotel took an hour as they where making up pollicies as they went along on how much they owed us,they charged us twice for a deposit then would not admit it even tho we had all recipts in front of us. so never ever ever stay there if your happy with staying in a caravan in amsterdam city this place is for you. the only good thing about this hotel is its location its only 2 mins from leidsplien,i lived in amsterdam for 2 years and stayed in a lot of hotels but this was the worst i have ever seen!!!!!!! run while you can sorry about the spelling but its rage typing...

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Situated Mozart Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jchmds
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about this hotel we wondered if we were taking a little more than a risk. Amsterdam has many many hotels, we searched long and hard to choose one which best fit the bill for us. We stayed for one night only and the facilities were adequate. We stayed in room 402, top floor, canal view. The twin beds were pushed together, as we like it, and very very comfortable. The radiator was thermostatically controlled and so had the room temperature just right. The bathroom was clean, no smells, just a little sealant mold on a part of the bath. Furnishings were basic. Small wardrobe, i wouldn't say it was big enough if you were staying more than a few days (two people). Nicely positioned TV. Missed having tea/coffee making facilities. There is a telephone in the room, but i found no details of charges. Incidently, if you wish to dial reception it's '9' ( We couldn't find any note or leaflet in our room with basic details on) The night we stayed, some idiots decided they would try and cheat the smoke alarm and lit up cigarettes, and set it off! They got caught, but it messed up the hotels alarms system for the night and a hour of my sleep! We heard virtually no noise, a few street revellers from the outside, and the occasional bang of a bedroom door. Morning continental breakfast, a great spread. I will always prefer my bacon & eggs & toast etc, but there was plenty to fill you up. The coffee machine tastes great but its not complimentary. Euro 1.5 for a small cup, don't forget to take a cup from beside the machine and place it under the nozzle to dispense the drink!!! Staff very friendly and helpful. We think the hotel charge is in keeping with the general expense of a City. We definitely would recommend this hotel based on our experience of one night.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel In Amsterdam's City Area's”
Reviews.Author: RB47worldwide
Reviews.Content: The Mozart Hotel is in a reasonable location for Amsterdams City Sightseeing & Shopping, Although reasonably small it was comfortable. The breakfast is only buffet style & pretty crowded at most of the time. All the staff were helpful during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “This was a Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: djanicki
Reviews.Content: I just cannot believe some of the negative junk that's written here about this Hotel. When I was in London before my trip to Amsterdam I read an article in the paper about the misuse of Trip advisor by rival hotels or "plants" that purposely write bad reviews... well this has to be what has happened here because the Mozart Hotel was absolutely perfect for what we wanted. First of all, its an EXCELLENT location. Right in front of a picturesque canal on a very quiet side street, but still close enough to great places to eat and drink when you want to. Its also extremely clean, I cannot believe the posts about cleanliness that I saw here. Its spotless. The rooms are totally fine, a bit on the smallish side, think New York City but for what I paid which was about $85 a night with a private bathroom and full breakfast, I couldn't have been happier. Its run by a very professional and friendly family who went out of their way to help me, the owner actually waited with us on the street for the Taxi to the airport because there was some road work at the end of the street, just to make sure it came on time. Look people, don't believe all the nonsense that's written here. For the price, it simply doesn't get any better than this. You can count on it.

Reviews.Title: “Rabbithutches in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Oxford
Reviews.Content: In summary - the smallest rooms you'll probably find, pretty grubby and nasty. But cracking good staff and a superb location. I was in Amsterdam for IBC and so expecting to pay a lot of money for a broom cupboard. Mozart didn't disappoint. â‚¬619 for two nights for two rooms. And you know those square polystyrene ceiling tiles? My room was precisely 9 of those square in area. I know, because I could could all of them from my bed. And touch the wall. And flush the lavatory. And open the window. There wasn't room to stand and clean your teeth at the sink because the lavatory was already standing there instead. Compact is one word you could use. Claustrophobic is another one. But the location is superb. Far enough out of the centre to be quiet but still close to restaurants and there's a tram stop 30 seconds walk away. Sit outside with a coffee at one of the tables and you have a canalside seat on Prinsengracht to watch Amsterdammers pedal past. And the staff are friendly and helpful. If the quality of the rooms matter - don't. If they don't, and you want a central canalside hotel and don't care about grubby and worn out, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: smaragdpete
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place at all cost. I stayed here during the IBC show and they were charging â‚¬180 per single room per night. The rooms are literally one single bed and the same amount of floor space so about 6m2 in total. The rooms are shabby and the bed linen dirty. This must rate as #1 on the list of world's worst hotels. I cannot understand that anyone would rate this to even be a hotel, it is not good enough to be a kennel let alone a hotel

Reviews.Title: “In the UK, Trades Descriptions stops places like this describing themselves as anything other than a doss house”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamerUk
Reviews.Content: Dreadful. where they get the idea that the word 'luxury' or 'romantic' can be used in the description is beyond me. In the UK, the law prevents such things It's sole benefit is a good location and it's sole good poitn was that it was clean Paper thin walls. 2 ft wide beds. nicotine colour wall paper A dive of the first order

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, clean, central”
Reviews.Author: petisa82
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mozart was the perfect starting point, off the often too busy tourist areas but within walking distance to all main attractions. The location right in the Prinsengracht was phanomenal. The hotel itself is not very spacious as many downtown hotels but very clean with basic equipment. Staff was very friendly and breakfast o.k. Pricey car parking nearby available and many different restaurants in the area. Please also see the "Two For Joy Coffee Roasting Company" in Frederijksplein 29, in walking distance! The best Amsterdam CafÃ© ever!

Reviews.Title: “nowhere near as bad as other reviewers say”
Reviews.Author: wtf74
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel review I have written but having read others about the Mozart and subsequently been dreading the stay I had booked as a surprise present for my husband's birthday, I felt it necessary to redress the balance a bit! If you have travelled and roughed it a bit, you will not be horrified by any stretch of the imagination by this hotel. Everything in Amsterdam is expensive, so expect to pay above the odds - even the Hot Deal I booked was overpriced in my opinion for this room (1st floor - not the dreaded basement I'd read so much about!) at 99 euro plus city tax for 1 night. But we got the impression that dear is the norm for the city. The location is good, loads around but not a noisy spot - noise inside the hotel was more of an issue, with revellers returning. But again, isn't that to be expected in lower priced accomm in this city (visitors appear predominantly to be uni aged lads, no surprises why)? It's a 30 min casual stroll from the central station. The decor was pretty tired, bed clean and comfortable, though slightly mascara stained pillow cases. The room was a bit pongy on arrival too but that seemed to be emanating from what appeared to be a bag of poo that someone had lobbed onto the ledge in the central ventilation shaft outside the window (perhaps another guest's verdict on the hotel ;) ). Closing the window and wiping surfaces with the cleaning wipes I'd packed sorted that out. The desk fan left on overnight kept the room adequately cool. No biggie. En suite bathroom was fine. All in all, really not so terrible. The staff were accommodating - we were allowed to check in early and breakfast items (pretty ordinary but edible enough and certainly not the "3 days old meat" other reviewers complained about) were happily replenished. If you aren't too precious and are reasonably experienced at travel, the Mozart is fine for a one night leisure stay. Probably helped that I expected it to be much worse than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Good Value”
Reviews.Author: nanner12wojo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very basic with no frills including 2 twin beds pushed together to make a full size bed. Besides that it was very clean, safe, and in a nice location. We were a block from dozens of great restaurants, walking distance from the Ann Frank House and not that far from the red light district but not too close.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Felix UK
Reviews.Content: This was not a cheap hotel. I didn't expect the Ritz - but expected a basic level of comfort. I must say it is in the best location possible. If you want the Dam and bars and the sex quarter - don't stay in this area. If you want beautiful canals, good cafes, interesting streets, art galleries and antiques - then this is perfect. My first room was underground. No light. No air. Dim light bulb. A sewage pipe that went through my room so I heard every toilet flush, with a constant stream once the showers started t 6.30 am. It was not clean. Marks on the sheets & walls, stains on chairs - didn't want to touch anything. They were very unhelfpul. However, they did agree to change my room to the top floor. As other reviews say - it was the smallest room I've ever been in. At least I had a small window with bright light and fresh air. This room seemed cleaner and I had a reasonable night sleep. Didn't bother with breakfast. The Nescafe machine and food on offer - in reception - were not at all appealing. So - my advice - don't stay there - but stay in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Close to museums, at the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DublinHillwalker
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, very central, beside museum district, on a typical canal, with trams nearby. Mozart Hotel is small, with rather tiny rooms, but clean, good continental breakfast, very helpful staff. No air-con. in the room, so could be too hot in summer. Lots of very affordable restaurants just around the corner. Lots of antique shops nearby. Good location if you want to easily access central Amsterdam. Ideal for short break.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vickster30
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and i can honestly say it is the worst hotel that i have EVER stayed in. If you like dirty rooms, net curtains that are older than the combined age of your party, net curtains that have cigarette burns in them, rooms that are so small you would think you are stood on a postage stamp, bedrooms that have dirty walls and shower heads that have NEVER been cleaned or like stepping out of the shower onto the toilet quite literally, or eating mouldy bread for breakfast then you will love this hotel. HOWEVER if the answer is no to all of the above then do yourself a favour and AVOID, AVOID & AVOID.... I am sure there used to be some wonderful points to say about this hotel but that was probably when it first opened, this hotel needs a massive refurb and some serious customer service thrown in too. The hotel is in a great location and could be a fab hotel with some tender loving care... So do yourself a favour and do not stay here, even if the price is a steel it is NOT worth it trust me...

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't pay me to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: misszapper
Reviews.Content: The lovely canal side location and pretty facade are thoroughly wasted on this sham of a hotel. I was thoroughly embarrased to take colleagues to this hotel, despite lining their pockets with just under 5000euros, it was clear that not a penny is spent on the upkeep of rooms or the breakfast facilities. From the moment you walk through the door the tired, scruffy surroundings, dank lighting and disorganised staff are clearly apparrent. The 'secure location' to leave luggage was actually just the hotel foyer, with no record of which room each bag belonged to. The lift was quite possibly the slowest, most archaeic, and should have been an indicator as to what lay ahead. Despite the no smoking signs our fourth floor corridor stank of smoke and no attempt seemed to have been made to fix this. On entering the room I was really dissapointed. Our twin rooms were really only big enough for one person and were thoroughly grotty - Dirty marks on all the walls, stinking shower curtains, bare electrical wiring in the bathroom and barely enough room to open your suitcase. Hoping for a nice view out of the window, we were greeted by a small courtyard within the building which housed the bins, and as our stay went on the rooms started to stink of rotting rubish as the cleaners continued to leave the windows open during the day. Just when we thought it couldn't get any worse we discovered that all the rooms contained mosquitos, no doubt attracted by the bins and many of my colleagues were covered in insect bites every morning. Breakfast was basic and budget, certainly not fitting of the price we'd paid or the 3 star rating the hotel claims, but we were horrified when one of my colleagues started eating a piece of toast, only to find that the bread was mouldy. Needless to say, after a terrible night's sleep, a quick shower avoiding the bare wiring and stinking curtain and a barely edible breakfast we weren't as well rested as we'd planned to be for our business trip. Reading the visitor book, it was clear that the only people who'd enjoyed their stay were naive young backpackers who'd barely noticed the filth through their smokey haze. Please don't waste your money - I wish we hadn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alcazar6969
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Mozart in March, After seeing the reviews was a little concerned as my flight only arrived into Amsterdam early evening. Upon check-in I found the young lady quiet but polite ans was given my room key after registration was completed. The Hotel is only 2 mins walf from the Preingrach tram stop and 5 mins from leidsplein (a lively sq) so a "great location" my advice from central station is get the 5 or 2 tram and disembark at Preingrach and then walk down the river bank (opposite the stop) (look out for small cinema) and hotel is 2 mins down this street (with the canal to your left) a couple of small coffe shops (smell of naughty stuff) and the hotel is there. Very clean and breakfast is from 07:00-10:00, However dont rush for this its basic but good for fruit and coffe only. I found this hotel excellent and in comparison to Acro near Museumsplein a better location and cleaner so YES will be returning once I recover from "crazy" Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: gabbi2690
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend break to Amsterdam and wanted to tell you my experience of this hotel. I booked the rooms 2 months ago through easytobook.com as a 'hot deal including breakfast' i booked a double and a twin room one for my boyfriend and i and one for his friends. After walking for 30 mins from central station we finally arrived at the hotel to be told that our room had been booked in for another day due to a mistake made by another employee. The lady at reception seemed completely rude and unapologetic and told us that they were fully booked an that she would have to find us somewhere else to say. After waiting half an hour to find out where we would be staying, she then tells us the only rooms she can find in the whole of amsterdam were a 3 bed room and a single room. I refused to accept this as it was the hotels fault and by law they have to provide us with something equal or better to what we had booked. Eventually after another hour of arguing she managed to book us into a different hotel with 2 double rooms, which we had to walk to try and find in the freezing cold and pouring rain. The hotel we were put up in was nice enough but further away from everything and a bit cheaper i suspect. I thought this was just unlucky but reading that someone else had the same experience makes me think its not a coincidence. Perhaps they take cheap bookings from websites but if someone comes in offering more money for the same room, they can make more money by putting us up in a different, cheaper hotel? Avoid this hotel at all costs, the staff are rude and unhelpful and they could ruin your trip like they did to us.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: UkPlatty
Reviews.Content: Dont go near the place! After travelling all the way from Frankfurt, Germany (tired, exhausted) I was told my room had been double booked and there was no room at the Hotel. The staff were very rude about the situation and didn't care whatsoever that they were completely out of order. I had to find another Hotel at last minute which double the cost of my accommodation. Avoid this Hotel. Find somewhere else. There are plenty of places to stay in Amsterdam. A Hotel who treats people this badly does not deserve customers.

Reviews.Title: “If your after a room to just dump your bags and hit the sack, this is ideal”
Reviews.Author: mellberg1983
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Mozart Hotel for one night. We only needed the hotel to dump our bags and then hit the sack before an early start, and this hotel - although bit basic - was ideal. Approx 5 min walk from the Liedesplein, also 2mins fom Tramstop to Centraal Station (we did walk from Centraal Station to the Hotel, took approx 30minutes at "pottering pace") - its ideally situated. Our room was small, and basic. Walls were thin and you could hear noise in the corridor. However, room was comfy and clean, with a nice powerful hot shower. As we had an early flight, we didn't have time to have the breakfast. To be honest, the hotel is probably more of a 2 start than 3, but I have rated it a 3 because it met our criteria as some where to crash out after watching the awesome Kasabian at the nearby Paradiso! Definately no frills, so don't use it if you're wanting to impress someone! But good enough for what we wanted. I would use the Hotel again, but only for the same reason.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, rooms bit small, great location”
Reviews.Author: adit3005
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights at this hotel. thought location was good, being walking distance to the museum park, and 5 minutes to the nearest tram stop - which is on the direct line to the central station. near shops, bars and restaurants. also a few nightclubs and jazz bars, so it suited me to a tee. breakfast didn't look good, and i just had a boil egg most days, preferring to buy fresh juice and bakery goods from the bakery near the tram stop. rooms were small but clean, linen and towel changed daily. lifts were working well but i didn't try to use the wireless. reception was very friendly and efficient, quick to offer advice on museum timings and direction. free map provided - unlike the tourist office that charges 2.50 euros. heating was a bit unreliable, being extremely hot on some nights and cold on others. overall an ok stay, no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is..”
Reviews.Author: AussieMegg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Mozart for 3 nights at the beginning of January (2010). We found the location to be good. Very close to a tram stop (which are very easy to use) and near Leidseplien. Leidseplien is one of the popular areas for its nightlife. We arrived and checked in at 2pm. However, when we went to our room it hadnâ€™t been serviced from the previous guests. So we had to take our luggage upstairs and wait for it to be serviced. The rooms are very small but were generally clean. We were in the basement which meant we did not receive wireless in our room so we had to go to the lobby to use the internet. This was annoying. The included breakfast is not very good. We paid 45 EUROS a night so we didnâ€™t have high expectations. If youâ€™re just using your hotel room to sleep then this hotel will suffice.

Reviews.Title: “smelly but served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: traveldreamer03
Reviews.Content: The room appeared clean but smelled. Since my room was in the basement and had a mildewy odor, I can only surmise of unfortunate flooding occurred. It did eventually go away w/ the window open. Or I just got use to it. Small room but served it's purpose. The price was more than advertised at the time. Mixed on recommending this room.

Reviews.Title: “not bad.”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandBeast
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms very small but if your only there to sleep go for it .Breakfast not great but you are right beside tram +river tour boat 9 euro hop on+off all you want close to Anne Frank house .

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Tidy Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gydko
Reviews.Content: I ordered a single room, and got a room with twin beds in the 4th floor. Room was really clean and nice, with new carpet and shining bathroom. Spacious enough, even if not huge. On a sunny day the room becomes too hot (a fan would have helped, but was not available). A DND sign could have also helped, as well as a chain on the door (worrying about getting caught naked by the cleaning lady?) The street (Prinsengracht) is quiet, and lcoation is great for walking everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Trip shame about the Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: westieHampshire
Reviews.Content: This was out 3rd visit to Amsterdam and we found this hotel was in a very good location, the staff helpful, good breakfast, hotel clean. Negative side if you stay in room 103 it is very noisy you are by the stairs which are wooden so you hear people coming in and out at night, there is no sound insulation in the room we had a waste disposal pipe running through our room it was like Victoria falls when people flushed the toilet so woke you up at night. Take ear plugs!!! Very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jayne56700
Reviews.Content: Good location and close to everything you could possibly wish to see and do. Hotel room was extremely small to say the least and walls very thin, however as a place to rest your head it served it's purpose. Big plus was that it was extremely clean which made up for size. Hotel staff friendly and helpful though the receptionist that booked us in was shall i say 'vague' ! took 40 minutes from arrival to actually checking into our room ! Breakfast was a bit of a let down as was tea / coffee facilities. Overall, clean, friendly, great location.. would recommend for those not wanting to 'chance it' with the unknown !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Atlanticspirit
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviewers comments on this site we were not sure what to expect, but overall I tend to agree with what many have said. The hotel is in an ideal location, close to tram stops 1,2, and 5, and within a short walk of the numerous restaurants on the leidseplein. On arrival, the staff were welcoming, and gave us a good deal of help as to what to see and do. Our room on the ground floor was very clean but basic, but too hot by far, even though the radiator was off. Being a weekend stay, there was quite a bit of noise from adjacent rooms, but after a few beers it never bothered us at all. The breakfast, served in a small area in the foyer, was more than adequate,and it set us up for the days sightseeing. Overall I would recomend this hotel to anyone travelling to Amsterdam for a short break, and on a budget, and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room with no view”
Reviews.Author: LazeeEye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, just a couple blocks from Light Square, but that's about the only plus. We were given a room in the basement that was very tomb-like. We couldn't tell if it was day or night. Two of the three nights of our stay, we were rudely awakened by the fire alarm going off repeatedly, all false alarms. At least the bed was comfortable. The price quoted in our email was bumped up by 10 euros for some random, previously undisclosed, service charge. The staff is cordial, but not overly helpful. We'd stay here again only if all other options in the same area were exhausted.

Reviews.Title: “Same hotel?????”
Reviews.Author: LynneH22
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the 'good' reveiws, I'm not sure we're talking about the same hotel!! Our room was on the 3rd floor, with a fan (from reception) going constantly, window wide open and radiator off, the temperature was nearly 30 degrees. Someone mentioned the fan in the bathroom - what fan?? Room was so small the only way we could pack to go home was to put the case on the bed - there was no way it could lie flat on the floor. My bed sloped so badly that trying to turn over was like trying to roll up hill, so most nights the only way I could sleep was sitting up! The door handle of the room our friends were in was hanging off on both sides. Having complained 3 times and been rescued once by staff as they couldn't get out, someone did come and 'fix' it - they stuck it down both sides with sellotape!! We will never again use this hotel and would certainly never recommend it! It didn't spoil our time in Amsterdam, as we love the city, but it tried it's best!

Reviews.Title: “No Classification - ask the VVV (Tourist Board)”
Reviews.Author: pendejito
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no stars at all- I asked at the Toursit Board and they must by law display thgis on the outside of the Hotel, they don't as they have no classification what so ever - BE AWARE- I do not understand why they can charge 3 * prices??

Reviews.Title: “WARNING !!!!!!! This Hotel is not even a YMCA”
Reviews.Author: dbeats
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the internet [--]. The staff is very very ... i mean very unfriendly, the rooms are not even tiny they are so small that in our country you would be not allowed to make a rentable room out of it. the breakfast is at the entrance of the hotel and it is lousy and weak. For example .: they serve simple toast but dont even have one single toaster. be aware when you check out of the hotel, because it doesnt have a baggage room. we paid nearly 140 euros for a double room / per night, i think its a shame that such hotels make your holiday worse.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms; good location”
Reviews.Author: rogermAustin
Reviews.Content: Plus: Although microscopic, the single room was clean and modern. And the location was good, on a canal and close to museums. negatives: Single room was the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in. Literally, about 2x3 meters in size, plus a tiny bathroom. Manager at hotel told me all the single rooms were this size. And policy of paying for entire stay upon check-in, not check-out, was a red flag that this was not a true "hotel" but a tourist trap. No internet in rooms (wireless in lobby). This is a functional hotel. It serves a purpose, but there is zero charm or hospitality. It is in a nice location

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: LellieLaois
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Amsterdam for three days and booked the hotel at â‚¬50 each a night. It was pleasant, clean and the staff were friendly. The location was excellent. The only downside is that we could hear the toilet flushing from the room above us. It was extremely loud. But if you're looking for cheap and cheerful this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Mozart hotel-= Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: loobyEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel after reading such wonderful reviews. The room was awful, it was tiny and very grubby. The walls were dirty, the room itself was very small and the facilities were non existent. There was no dresser, tea or cofee facilities and the double bed was 2 singles pushed together. We had to pay before we saw the room, immediately on check-in. On entering the hotel to check in the foyer was full of smoke and the receptionist had a very 'couldn't give a damn' attitude, we didn't even bother to go to breakfast. Never again. This was our first and very much last visit to Amsterdam, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, it spoiled our weekend and I could not wait to return home.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good value”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: Lovely new decor and flatscreen tv clean modern en suite pleasant self serve breakfast near leidseplein

Reviews.Title: “A memorable place loved Hotel and Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lorraineAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We had read reveiws on many hotels in Amsterdam and had read some negative comments and postive comments . I can honestley say we have both never been looked after so well espacally Velislava the receptionist,she gave us the most fab room overlooking the canal and was so helpfull. breakfast is basic but very nice although it gets very busy . You are right in centre of resteraunts and bars and only a 2min ride to red light/central station . We went on a canal cruise wich was very nice . The highlight was my boyfriend proposed by the canal regards lorraine & jus feb 2007

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: BramBORKA
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised by the quality of the room. Last time I stayed in Amsterdam for similar price, so I expected similarly reasonable, but not great, hotel. Here, the room was much bigger, much cleaner and better furnished. We were also lucky, we got the room with canal view (without even asking) on the to floor. The breakfast were also great, the staff... I can't say anyghing against it, only that we didn't know how to turn off the fan in the bathroom so it was a bit cold in there, but that's not a problem, for the money. We were really very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Out For Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Wander-Winner
Reviews.Content: It is a shame when the owners just renovated a classic canal house that they only tried to figure out how to get the most amount of people into the smallest possible space. We paid a premium for a canal room -- it was teeny and uncomfortable. The coarsest bed linens, not a Kleenex or any other amenity, hardly any space to turn around in, no closet, no dresser, the meanest, narrowest bed. When you check in, they make you pay for your room in advance, before you see it -- and they want a deposit for the television remote (who takes a remote from a hotel?). The room was over Euro 200 each night -- and we never had breakfast because of the scarcity of food and the long long lines. We found the people at the desk very disinterested in saying hello, helping or doing anything. If you get a phone call and are out, they open your room and leave a scribbled note -- in 2006! Never again. I have stayed in dozens of Dutch hotels over hte years and chose this one because it was near a friend's house -- this was the worst hotel experience and hard to believe that it is Dutch-managed. Take heed and GO ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor, but a little claustaphobic”
Reviews.Author: ALaw
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were checked into our rooms - myself and my partner were given a double ensuite room in the basement which although modern and brightly decorated was fairly compact and you had the feeling of being on a ship as the small corner window let in little day light and indeed the room with a nice view we had requested faced into what looked like a lift shaft. That aside, the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were immaculate and cleaned every day with fresh towels. Breakfast was continental and there were often queues for the coffee machine. (An additional machine would be ideal). You ate breakfast in the foyer. Location was fairly good if you know what steet to ask for Leiden Stein, otherwise taxis took you a tour of the whole canal! Overall, our stay went without any hitches, though I would have much preferred a room on one of the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “i DO NOT recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: rachele78
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a room at the Mozart Hotel, where we stayed for two nights, as we read enthusiastic reviews about it. Well, it was a great disappointment! First of all, we were given a extremely small room (9 sq. meters!!!),where a twin bed (not a dobule, as requested), a chair and a small closet were placed. The result was that we could not even move around! The room was terribly dark: there was only a small window, that was directly facing the window of the room in front of us (at a distance of less than 3 mt.), so that we could not even let the curtains open witouth our neighbours seeing us! Moreover, breakfast was awful: it was served in a tiny space close to the reception desk and we also had to queue because there were not enough tables to fit all the guests. The hotel is pretty far from the town center (Dam Square etc..). We paid 110 â‚¬ per room per night, which is a pretty high sum for the services we were offered...So, if you are looking for a quite, comfortable and relaxing holiday in Amsterdam do not choose Mozart Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: mirulko
Reviews.Content: Me and my 2 friends stayed in Mozart hotel in July 2006. The hotel is in a nice area, 10 minutes walk from flower market and 5 minutes from one very busy square with a lot of restaurants. We got a room with double bed (2 singles put together) and one extra bed. Room was nice and clean. Everything run smoothly, we didn't have any problems, staff was excellent. I recommend the hotel to everybody!!!!! Miro from Slovakia (living in London)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel for many, many Years. By accident we ended up at the Mozart hotel, after being send away at hotel PC. Sending us away, was the best thing that happend to us in Amsterdam. After the very warm welcome of the reception, we ended up in a very nice room. We had all the Equipments we needed ( wardrobe, LCD TV, Night lamp, telephone). The hairdryer en remote controle, we had to get from the reception after paying a deposit! The reception informed us very well about all the sightseeing, and all the attraction in and around amsterdam. They even could book excursion for us. After looking back we can honoustly say that the staff of hotel mozart, made our stay wonderfull. My compliments!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst CUSTOMER Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and her three friends booked this hotel for my fiancÃ©â€™s Hen Night. (Booked well over a month in advance!) They arrived at around 10pm, to be told that they had the booking, but no spare rooms. With no apology, and very little offer of assistance. Generally rude attitudes by the staff of the hotel. Not much you can really do at 10pm at night. But finally two rooms were offered in their sister hotel - completely away from Dam Square (the whole point for booking the Mozart Hotel). Incorrect directions were given, no Taxi offered - and they had to walk for about an hour in the pouring rain. Their sister hotel, then provided SMOKING rooms - and keycards which didn't work along with rooms which were 2 floors apart. You can-not trust this hotel in the slightest - if they can't even provide you with rooms that have been booked weeks in advance. You just can't guarantee that your room is even going to exist! AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Plain, simple but effective”
Reviews.Author: mos13_2000
Reviews.Content: We booked the Mozart last minute after another hotel cancelled our booking, but what a good find! Situated round the corner from nearly everything you need, myself and 4 lads spent 3 nights here during a stag do to remember. The hotel is a 15 euro taxi ride from the main train station, and is situated right on one off the many canals. When we stayed the place had been open only 48 hours so everything was clean but things kept appearing in rooms like coat hangers, shower curtains and even a 23" lcd in one room! It had an "unfinished feel" but im sure that has now been addressed. The hotel is 200 yards from a lively square that has several hundred bars and clubs, a burger king, macdonalds and a bit further down a casino. In the other direction is a 15 minute walk to the red light disctrict and 25 minutes from the train station. There is always someone on the desk to help, and they are indeed helpful (and attractive!) The downsides are the single room we were given was barely big enough for the bed and with the suitcase on the floor the door didnt even open. The stairs are very steep and the lift was a bit dodgy to say the least. Breakfast was plain but functional, but worst of all, when we were there they didnt take credit or debit card at the desk and demanded cash for the 3 rooms! ow! If you are looking for a comfy warm bed for the night and a short stagger home this place was great value for money and would definitely recommend for a good lads/laddets weekend. Not one for the older generation or families though. Thanks Mozart.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should have read the earlier review before we stayed here! The good part is the location - great for the museums & restaurants, close to a tram stop. True, the hotel has just been renovated, and yes the rooms are clean, BUT: Our room looked on to a ventilation shaft that smelled of drains - you could only see the sky by craning out of the window. Only storage in a double room was 2 tiny bedside tables. No wardrobe, just 3 coat hangers on wall hooks. Not enough light to read except by sitting on the bed & using the bedside light. No shower curtain - so wet bathroom floor. Breakfast area much too small for the number of people. Expect to wait for a table. Breakfast itself disappointing but adequate (no fresh fruit, 1 domestic coffee machine trying to serve everyone at once). Credit card machine still not arrived - need to pay in cash. Electronic door locks seem beyond the ability of the staff to program them - multiple errors including initially being given a key to a room that was already occupied. The staff did try to be helpful, but need a lot of training. This is just about OK for a couple of days if you want to stay in this part of the city - more than that would be claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't always believe the web-site!”
Reviews.Author: esjas12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on this web-site. --- The hotel re-opened after refurbishment on 4 April, we were due to stay on the 7 - 10 April. The description: "Hotel Mozart Amsterdam equips 47 rooms witch has a stylish interior and private facilities like a bathroom, toilet, television, radio and a hairdryer. All our rooms have a beautiful view. There are rooms that have silent and romantic view, where you can see from there the panorama on the canal or the cosy backside whit his monumental view." is total inaccurate. Our room on the 4th Floor did not have TV, hairdryer, telephone and the view was into a tiny courtyard and another bedroom window, little light nevermind the monumental view! The room size was very small even by continentalm standards. One twin bed in the room and that was all. No wardrobe to hang clothes and little space to put our case on the floor. We checked in at 18:00 and checked out at 18:30. Finally, the reception did not have a credit card machine and asked to be paid in cash. We did not pay!!

HotelInfo.Name: Mozart Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Prinsengracht 518 - 520, Amsterdam 1017, The Netherlands
